name: Kanjeevaram Silk Saree
description: Originating from Kanchipuram, Tamil Nadu, this saree is renowned for its rich silk fabric and intricate gold zari work.

name: Banarasi Silk Saree
description: Hailing from Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh, Banarasi sarees are known for their opulent silk and elaborate brocade designs.

name: Mysore Silk Saree
description: A classic from Karnataka, Mysore silk sarees are appreciated for their smooth texture and minimalist elegance.

name: Pochampally Ikat Saree
description: From Telangana, these sarees feature distinctive geometric patterns created through the Ikat dyeing technique.

name: Kasavu Saree
description: Traditional attire from Kerala, characterized by its white fabric with golden borders, symbolizing purity and elegance.

name: Chanderi Saree
description: Originating from Madhya Pradesh, Chanderi sarees are lightweight and known for their sheer texture and fine zari work.

name: Sambalpuri Saree
description: A handwoven saree from Odisha, featuring traditional motifs and the unique Bandha (Ikat) dyeing technique.

name: Paithani Saree
description: Maharashtra's pride, Paithani sarees are known for their vibrant colors and intricate peacock motifs woven in gold thread.

name: Bandhani Saree
description: A tie-dye saree from Gujarat and Rajasthan, featuring vibrant patterns created by plucking the cloth into bindings before dyeing.

name: Baluchari Saree
description: From West Bengal, these silk sarees are adorned with depictions of mythological scenes woven into the pallu.

name: Tant Saree
description: A traditional Bengali cotton saree, known for its lightness and transparency, making it ideal for the hot climate.

name: Kalamkari Saree
description: Featuring hand-painted or block-printed designs, Kalamkari sarees from Andhra Pradesh depict mythological narratives and nature-inspired motifs.

name: Ilkal Saree
description: A traditional saree from Karnataka, recognized by its red to maroon borders and pallu with distinct patterns.

name: Uppada Saree
description: Originating from Andhra Pradesh, Uppada sarees are known for their lightweight silk and intricate Jamdani weaving technique.

name: Coimbatore Cotton Saree
description: From Tamil Nadu, these cotton sarees are appreciated for their comfort and subtle designs, suitable for daily wear.
